intro: Aristotelia macqui var. andina, commonly known as the Andean wineberry, is a shrub native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its small, fleshy fruits that resemble berries and are typically red or purple in color. The plant has small, elliptical leaves with a slightly hairy texture and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. It is adapted to high altitudes and has a relatively low water requirement. The fruit is edible and has been traditionally used in local cuisines and for its medicinal properties.
